question: Which of the following statements about inertia is INCORRECT?

options.a: Inertia is the tendency of an object to resist changes in its state of motion.
options.b: Inertia depends on the mass of the object.
options.c: Inertia is a force that keeps objects at rest.
options.d: Heavier objects have greater inertia than lighter objects.

question: A car is moving at a constant speed of 20 m/s. What is the net force acting on the car?

options.c: Cannot be determined without knowing the mass of the car.
options.d: Depends on the direction of motion.

question: A force of 10 N is applied to a 2 kg object. What is the acceleration of the object?
A bullet is fired from a gun. Which of the following experiences a greater force?

options.d: It depends on the mass of the bullet and gun.

question: Which of the following is an example of Newton's third law of motion?

options.a: A ball rolling down a hill.
options.c: A book resting on a table.
options.d: A swimmer pushing off the wall of a pool.

question: A 5 kg object is moving with a momentum of 25 kg m/s. What is its velocity?
Two objects with equal masses collide and stick together. If the initial velocity of one object was 10 m/s and the other was at rest, what is the velocity of the combined object after the collision?
Which of the following situations demonstrates the principle of conservation of momentum?

options.b: A ball bouncing off a wall.
options.c: A book falling from a table.
options.d: A person walking on a frictionless surface.

question: A 10 kg object is at rest on a frictionless surface. A force of 5 N is applied to it for 4 seconds. What is the final velocity of the object?
A 2 kg ball is dropped from a height of 10 meters. What is its momentum just before it hits the ground? (Assume g = 10 m/s²)
A 0.5 kg ball is thrown vertically upwards with an initial velocity of 20 m/s. What is its momentum at the highest point of its trajectory?
A car of mass 1000 kg is moving at a speed of 20 m/s. It collides with a stationary truck of mass 2000 kg. If the two vehicles stick together after the collision, what is their combined velocity?
A force of 10 N acts on an object for 5 seconds. If the object's initial velocity was 2 m/s, what is its final velocity? (Assume the object has a mass of 2 kg)
A 1 kg ball is thrown horizontally with a velocity of 10 m/s from a height of 5 meters. What is its momentum just before it hits the ground? (Assume g = 10 m/s²)
A 50 kg person is standing on a frictionless surface. They throw a 2 kg ball horizontally with a velocity of 10 m/s. What is the recoil velocity of the person?
Which of the following has the greatest momentum?

options.a: A 1000 kg car moving at 10 m/s
options.b: A 100 kg motorcycle moving at 100 m/s
options.c: A 10 kg bicycle moving at 1000 m/s

question: A 2 kg object is at rest on a frictionless surface. A force of 4 N is applied to it for 2 seconds. What is the change in momentum of the object?
A 10 kg object is moving with a velocity of 5 m/s. A force of -2 N is applied to it for 5 seconds. What is the final velocity of the object?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It collides with a stationary 1 kg object. If the two objects stick together after the collision, what is their combined velocity?
A 50 kg person is standing on a skateboard. They throw a 2 kg ball horizontally with a velocity of 10 m/s. What is the recoil velocity of the person and skateboard?
A 0.1 kg bullet is fired from a rifle with a velocity of 500 m/s. If the rifle has a mass of 5 kg, what is the recoil velocity of the rifle?
A 1000 kg car is moving at a speed of 20 m/s. It brakes and comes to a stop in 5 seconds. What is the average braking force acting on the car?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It experiences a constant force of -2 N for 2 seconds. What is the final velocity of the object?
A 0.5 kg ball is thrown vertically upwards with an initial velocity of 10 m/s. What is its maximum height? (Assume g = 10 m/s²)
A 10 kg object is at rest on a frictionless surface. A force of 5 N is applied to it for 4 seconds. What is the distance traveled by the object?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It collides with a stationary 1 kg object. If the two objects stick together after the collision, what is the kinetic energy lost in the collision?
A 50 kg person is standing on a skateboard. They throw a 2 kg ball horizontally with a velocity of 10 m/s. What is the change in momentum of the person and skateboard?
A 0.1 kg bullet is fired from a rifle with a velocity of 500 m/s. If the rifle has a mass of 5 kg, what is the kinetic energy of the bullet?
A 1000 kg car is moving at a speed of 20 m/s. It brakes and comes to a stop in 5 seconds. What is the work done by the braking force?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It experiences a constant force of -2 N for 2 seconds. What is the change in kinetic energy of the object?
A 0.5 kg ball is thrown vertically upwards with an initial velocity of 10 m/s. What is its kinetic energy at the highest point of its trajectory?
A 10 kg object is at rest on a frictionless surface. A force of 5 N is applied to it for 4 seconds. What is the work done by the force?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It collides with a stationary 1 kg object. If the two objects stick together after the collision, what is the kinetic energy of the combined object?
A 50 kg person is standing on a skateboard. They throw a 2 kg ball horizontally with a velocity of 10 m/s. What is the work done by the person on the ball?
A 0.1 kg bullet is fired from a rifle with a velocity of 500 m/s. If the rifle has a mass of 5 kg, what is the kinetic energy of the rifle?
A 1000 kg car is moving at a speed of 20 m/s. It brakes and comes to a stop in 5 seconds. What is the power dissipated by the braking force?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It experiences a constant force of -2 N for 2 seconds. What is the power delivered by the force?
A 0.5 kg ball is thrown vertically upwards with an initial velocity of 10 m/s. What is its power at the highest point of its trajectory?
A 10 kg object is at rest on a frictionless surface. A force of 5 N is applied to it for 4 seconds. What is the average power delivered by the force?
A 2 kg object is moving with a velocity of 4 m/s. It collides with a stationary 1 kg object. If the two objects stick together after the collision, what is the power dissipated in the collision?
